Research: Stress and Fatigue
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Research: Stress and Fatigue
By Jimeous on Wednesday, August 6, 2003 - 03:09 am:

Fatigue
Fatigue 0 : Monster looks really Energetic
Fatigue 1 - 190 : Monster looks pretty lively
Fatigue 191 - 290 : Monster seems to be in good shape
Fatigue 291 - 390 : Monster seems to be a little tired
Fatigue 391 - 490 : Monster is tired
Fatigue 491 - 690 : Monster is really worn out.
Fatigue 691 - 890 : Monster is exhausted.
Fatigue 891 - 999 : Monster about to collapse!

Items which remove Fatigue
HonCandy : Removes 30 Fatigue
OilyOil : Removes 128 Fatigue
MntCandy : Removes 100 Stress and Removes 50 Fatigue.

SilvrCup : Removes 5 Fatigue per week
GoldCup : Removes 25 Fatigue per week
HolyCup : Removes 45 Fatigue per week

Cups are not accumulative, in other words owning more than one cup of different types of cups will not remove more Fatigue

Conditions which affect Fatigue
Completing a Tournament : Adds 300-303 Fatigue
Withdrawing or Giving up in a Tournament: Adds 400-403 Fatigue
Getting seriously injured in a Tournament: Adds 500-503 Fatigue
Training not included at this stage, not sure if I will research this

STRESS
Stress: 291 - 490: Monster seems a little stressed.
Stress: 491 - 690: Monster seems pretty stressed.
Stress: 691 - 999: Monster seems really stressed.

Items which remove Stress
NitroBer : Removes 50 Stress
MintLeaf : Removes 80 Stress
MntCandy : Removes 100 Stress and Removes 50 Fatigue.

ShinyGem : Removes 3 Stress per week
GlimrGem : Removes 13 Stress per week
BrghtGem : Removes 23 Stress per week

Gem affects not accumulative, in other words owning more than one gem or more types of gems will not remove more Stress

Conditions which affect Stress
Not Scolding monster after failing : Removes 20 Stress
Not Praising monster after a GREAT training : Adds 30 Stress
Praising a monster after a GREAT training : Removes 50 Stress

Winning a Tournament : Removes 400-403 Stress
Withdrawing or Giving up after a tournament: Removes 300-303 Stress

Not Praising after winning a tournament : Adds 30 Stress
Praising after winning a tournament : Removes 50 Stress

Not Praising it after placing : Adds 50 Stress
Praising after placing in a tournament: Removes 20 Stress

Training not included, again not sure if I'll research this

RESTING

Resting no items : Removes 220-250 Stress and 420-500 Fatigue

Incense : Removes 260-300 Stress and 520-600 Fatigue per Rest
AromaPot : Removes 320-400 Stress and 720-800 Fatigue per Rest

Incense and AromaPot work only when resting, and are not accumulative.

By Jimeous on Wednesday, August 6, 2003 - 04:26 am:

Fatigue Vs Battles

Fatigue affects stats at 310, or when a Monster seems a little tired.

Some rough guides of losses in stats follows.

Monster looks really Energetic : No Stat Loss
Monster looks pretty lively : No Stat Loss
Monster seems to be in good shape : No Stat Loss
Monster seems to be a little tired : Stat Loss 0-9%
Monster is tired : Stat Loss 9-19%
Monster is really worn out : Stat Loss 19-39%
Monster is exhausted. : Stat Loss 39-59%
Monster about to collapse! : Stat Loss 59-69%

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, August 6, 2003 - 04:53 am:

Where are you getting these numbers?

Is it an arbitrary scale you came up with?

A little background on your methodology would be good.

By Jimeous on Wednesday, August 6, 2003 - 05:35 am:

You need errrrr the computer version of the game, you'll also need a program to be able to check memory. Knowledge about the game, addressing and hexing is also vital.

You could probably do this with Codebreaker, if you know how to do searches and what relevant addresses need to be monitored.

A codebreaker code for Energy is [You'll need the activation codes for it to work]

82006DE6 0000

This sets Energy to zero

If you know how to Hex, you'll convert 191 into a Hex, in this case its 005B

This will set the Energy to 191, after resting the message "Monster seems to be in good shape" will appear.

Monitoring addresses should be an easy task, if you know what you are doing. I prefer the PC way myself, it gives me better control over the values.

I've described the simplest methodology for convenience

By Jimeous on Wednesday, August 6, 2003 - 07:14 pm:

In answer the questions.

A monsters preference for snack doesn't affect the amount of stress or energy which is reduced. The affect is on Reliance and Personality.

The other snacks affect a monsters figure, thereby affecting its training.

Magnus those are interesting numbers, looks like your monsters figure may have been fat :)

Light Training Vs Stress and Fatigue

Test Subject used: A Wolfkin, freshly shrined using a password. Traits: Up Fangs and Expert. Monsters' personality was normal. Additional tests the same for a 5 month old Volcano

Light training used: Shove

Normal : Adds 98 - 112 Stress if light training successful or great
Normal : Adds 144 - 172 Stress if light training fails
Normal : Adds 110 - 141 Fatigue

Fat : Adds 55 - 68 Stress if light training successful or great
Fat : Adds 82 - 103 Stress if light training fails
Fat : Adds 170 - 199 Fatigue

Obese : Adds 48 - 55 Stress if light training successful or great
Obese : Adds 76 - 82 Stress if light training fails
Obese : Adds 200 - 247 Fatigue

Untested: Thin and Slim

Notes:
Training to be used as a reference, needs more tests and observations regarding a monsters preferred training areas. ie the areas it is suitable as a coach in.

Need to test monsters personalities further, will Spoilt affect Stress/Energy or do personalities affect the stat outcome?.

Need to confirm monsters' age, ie the crucial period of training and old age.

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, August 6, 2003 - 08:43 pm:

Other things to check for training: Weather. It may only
effect gains for Life drills, but there is the possibility of
other bonuses.

By Jimeous on Wednesday, August 6, 2003 - 10:03 pm:

Good point GB :)

I may need to make a note of "Seasons"

Some more observations:

Test Subject: Wolfkin, freshly shrined, Light Training : Shove, Month Apr, Year 1

Trait : GlssHart - Great training results but tire easily
No Changes in Stress levels.

Normal : Adds 220 - 280 Fatigue
Fat : Adds 320 - 400 Fatigue
Obese : Adds 420 - 500 Fatigue

Trait : IronHart - Training hard won't tire the monster out.
No Changes in Stress Levels.

Normal : Adds 100 - 125 Fatigue
Fat : Adds 150 - 180 Fatigue
Obese: Adds 180 - 220 Fatigue

By Nate Railsback on Thursday, August 7, 2003 - 03:29 am:

Excellent work, Jimeous and Magnus! I've been wanting to see stuff like this. I have a question, though-- does the stat loss from fatigue happen ANY time you get fatigued, or just when you battle while that way? Because I never noticed losing stats except when a battle began.

By Jimeous on Thursday, August 7, 2003 - 06:27 am:

Fatigue stat loss only affects battles, there seems to be no affect on training or when you're "inactive".

By Nate Railsback on Thursday, August 7, 2003 - 02:43 pm:

By Magnus on Thursday, August 7, 2003 - 02:53 pm:

for example, my siva was tired when the the zan sp-u obro(tired stat lower were:
pow:674->362
int:524->290
acc:437->261
spd:746->473
def:391->123
lif:294->98
i lost that battle obviosely.also my siva was then exuasted after the battle.

By Nate Railsback on Thursday, August 7, 2003 - 03:03 pm:

By Jimeous on Thursday, August 7, 2003 - 08:23 pm:

Magnus the stat loss is calculated using a formula based on the amount of Fatigue of the monster.

At 310 when it starts its roughly about 1%

I'm guessing the formula is something like...

( (Fatigue - 309) /100 ) * stat

Where Fatigue is greater than 309

Nate

Life Spans? I've read some of the research, it sounds quite tricky to me :p

By Jimeous on Thursday, August 7, 2003 - 08:27 pm:

Errr make that formula

AdjustedStat = Stat - ( ( (Fatigue - 309) /100 ) * Stat )

By GoldenBoy on Friday, August 8, 2003 - 06:53 am:

More accurately, Nate wants to know about lifespan "hits"

By Jimeous on Friday, August 8, 2003 - 08:49 am:

Well :)

The ideal situation is 0 Stress, 0 Fatigue and any figure except Obesity. Monthly feeds can be anything.

Under these conditions
Resting decreases LifeSpan by 10
Training [any type] reduces Lifespan by 10
Battling reduces LifeSpan by 10
Sparring reduces LifeSpan by 45

It is when you add in Stress, Fatigue, Obesity and no monthly feeding that the numbers start to rise.

Obesity or not Feeding with no Stress or Fatigue
Resting decreases LifeSpan by 15
Training [any type] reduces Lifespan by 15
Battling reduces LifeSpan by 15
Sparring reduces LifeSpan by 62

I haven't worked out the combinations, I was too busy doing the "base LifeSpans" :p

By Jimeous on Friday, August 8, 2003 - 08:53 am:

I'd also add...

You'll never get 15 in Training or Battling because both use Fatigue, thats the ugly part, is working out the additional loss with those factors.

:p
